title: Start
body:
This is a test!!!

The test continues!

And here is the last line.

title: Example_Encounter
body: No birds yet.

title: Example_SmallTalk
body: Example Dialog

title: Day_Chat_01
body:
Well, here we are. Yosemete park.

Nice trees, right?

...

...

I think I heard some birds in this direction.

Let's go snap some pictures.

title: Day_Chat_02
body: Nice looking birds, out here.

title: Day_Chat_03
body:
How long do you want to stay out here?

Before we head back to the cabin?

I dunno.

If I were to guess, three more birds.

title: AW_Start
body:
An Acorn Woodpecker appeared! 

Look at that red cap!

title: Effect_Good
body: You did a thing and the bird is affected somehow!

title: Too_Agitated
body:
Your hands are too shakey to take a photo!

You need to relax!

title: Effect_Bad
body: Uh, ok, that bird is not looking happy.

title: AW_Battle_Exit
body:
Nice photo!

Hey, did you know that Acron Woodpeckers like to hoard acorns?

They peck out holes in trees, and then stash tons of acorns inside the holes.

I guess sometimes... the acorn... doesn't fall far from the tree!

title: AW_AG_GREAT
body: The woodpecker is calmly adjusting its stash of nuts.

title: AW_AG_OK
body: The woodpecker is pecking out a hole in the tree.

title: AW_AG_BAD
body: The woodpecker is squawking and flying around.

title: Bird_Fled
body: They fley away. Drat!

title: Battle_Exit
body: Nice Picture!

title: AW_Approach
body: I'm hearing some loud squawks in this direction. Wonder what it is...

title: Bird_Found
body: Bird sighted!

title: BT_Start
body:
A flock of Bushtits appeared!

They're so fluffy!

title: BT_Approach
body: Sounds like there's a flock of songbirds nearby.

title: BT_Battle_Exit
body:
Nice photo!

Bushtits like to hang upside down sometimes when looking for food.

They like to sit in bushes and are almost always in flocks.

If there's 30 in a bush, how much would one in the hand be worth?

title: BT_AG_GREAT
body: The bushtits are resting in some shrubs.

title: BT_AG_OK
body: The bushtits are singing and flying around.

title: BT_AG_BAD
body: The bushtits are swarming up, angrily squeaking!

title: AK_Start
body: It's an American Kestrel!

title: AK_Approach
body: Sounds like there's a kestrel-like bird nearby.

title: AK_Battle_Exit
body:
Nice photo!

Kestrels are North America's littlest falcon.

Of course, that doesn't stop snatching up all kinds of prey.

...

...

... yeah...

title: AK_AG_GREAT
body: The kestrel is resting on a fence post.

title: AK_AG_OK
body: The kestrel is flying around, looking for prey.

title: AK_AG_BAD
body: The kestrel is angrily diving at the ground!

title: Camera_NotEnoughShots
body: We should take a couple more shots to make sure we get a good one.

title: Run_Away_Option
body: Look for a different bird?

title: Run_Away
body: Yeah. Let's go look for other birds.

title: AG_OK
body: Your hands are getting a little jittery.

title: AG_BAD
body: Your poor breathing is spooking them!

title: AG_GREAT
body: You feel perfectly calm.

title: AG_LEAVE
body: The bird flew away! You spooked them too much!

title: Day_Chat_04
body:
Hey, why'd you bring that bag of seed?

I want some photos of them eating.

We're not supposed to feed the animals here.

...

That's ok. I'm still doing it.

title: Day_Chat_05
body: Last one for now.

title: End_Of_Day
body: Let's head back. I need a rest.

title: Intermission_01
body:
Back at the cabin. Let's take a load off.

...

Hey, why'd you bring that bag of seed?

I want some photos of them eating.

We're not supposed to feed the animals here.

...

That's ok. I'm still doing it.

...

Fine.

GOT BAG OF SEED.

TRANSITION TO EVENING

Hey.

Want to look at some more birds before we turn in?

Sure.

title: Too_Calm
body: You are already as calm as can be.

title: WS_Approach
body: Looks like there's something moving in the river.

title: WS_Start
body:
It's a Wilson's Snipe!

That beak is so long!

title: SJ_Start
body:
It's a Steller's Jay!

Wow! Such a bright color!

title: SJ_Approach
body: There's a hint of blue in the trees over there.

title: SJ_Battle_Exit
body: Nice photo!

title: WS_Battle_Exit
body: Nice photo!

title: Night_Chat_01
body: Now it is night time.

title: Night_Chat_02
body: Now it is night time 2.

title: Night_Chat_03
body: Now it is night time 3.

title: Night_Chat_04
body: Now it is night time 4.

title: Night_Chat_05
body: Now it is night time 5.

body: It is raining

title: Rain_Chat_02
body: It is raining 2

title: Rain_Chat_03
body: It is raining 3

title: Rain_Chat_04
body: It is raining 4

title: Rain_Chat_05
body: It is raining 5

title: Intermission_02
body: This is the second intermission.

title: EG_Approach
body: Evening Grosbeak or something

title: EG_Start
body: Evening Grosbeak or something

title: EG_Battle_Exit
body: Nice photo!

title: NS_Start

title: Intermission_03
body:
Congrats for making it all the way to the end.

That is more effort than I expected.

TODO: have actual ending

title: Encounter_Tutorial
body:
Info: Hello, I am this computer game's developer with some helpful tips to get you through the game.
Info: Our goal here is to get a good photo of that bird over there.
Info: If you use your camera, you can snap some photos of it. I think we need fifteen photos before we get a good one.
Info: When you're ready to start, move your mouse cursor over the camera icon and perform a click.
Info: This computer game is operated only by moving the mouse and clicking, so don't worry about any other keyboard buttons.

title: Post_Camera_Tutorial
body:
Info: Taking photos can get stressful! If you get too stressed then you won't be able to operate the camera. 
Info: We may need to do some breathing exercises to calm down when that happens.
Info: Right now you're only a little stressed out, so you can take another set of pictures first, if you'd like

title: Camera_Tutorial
body:
Info: It is me, the game's developer again. Sorry to be back so soon!
Info: To snap a picture of a bird, hover your cursor over the bird and click the mouse button to snap a photo.
Info: If the bird is in the center of the camera's frame, you'll take a picture that's worth two!

title: Breathing_Tutorial
body:
Info: Ready to chill out?
Info: Start by depressing the mouse button, and then release it when the blue meter near the green zone on the right.
Info: Then, depress the mouse button when it approaches the green zone on the left.
Info: Keep it up and you'll be calmer in no time!
